p: In our Institution, since the outbreak of the infection, we experienced a very strict collaboration between the otolaryngologist and the personnel dedicated to the swab collection. The latter benefited from observing the endoscopic anatomy of the patient and interacting with the otolaryngologist during the examination so that they were eventually able to acquire major confidence with the procedure if compared to the lone description or the passive observation of a video. Even patients referred less discomfort during the sampling procedure and were obviously more compliant.
